page.title: 10Boats for fun in Uyeasound.
page.content: In Uyeasound a lot of people own boats.People who have motor boats have them moored at the pier at the Westside.People use these boats to go out fishing,mostly beyond Muness.Some lay creels to catch lobsters and crabs.I sometimes have great fun fishing with my cousin from his father's speedboat.Speedboats are sometimes used at the sailing events as rescue crafts. Some people have sailing boats;maids or dingies.The shape of the maid is far different to a dingie.Maids are longer,thinner and have longer masts; they are Shetland model boats.Dingies take two people and maids take three. In 1985 there are 4 weeks of Sunday races in Uyeasound in the Sound of Uyea.The maids sail for the Uyea Cup and the dingies for the Chevron Cup. The 1985 Regatta is on 29th June.
